intro: Euothonaea, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe. The plants typically have showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. They are often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Euothonaea species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
